content.value_statement: Creating consistent, secure API endpoints in Next.js requires following proper patterns for authentication, validation, and error handling. This skill provides ready-to-use code patterns and a checklist for building production-ready endpoints.
actual_capabilities: Provide GET and POST endpoint patterns
limitations: Does not generate complete files automatically
No custom logic generation beyond patterns

best_practices: Always validate workspace_id before any database operation
Use withErrorBoundary wrapper for consistent error handling
Filter ALL database queries by workspace_id for multi-tenant security
anti_patterns: Skipping workspace validation for internal endpoints
Returning raw database errors to clients
Missing TypeScript types for request and response

faq.question: Which Next.js versions are supported?
faq.answer: Next.js 15 and later versions using the App Router and the NextRequest type.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for API endpoints?
faq.answer: Rate limits depend on your Supabase plan. The skill does not add additional limits.

faq.question: Can this integrate with authentication providers other than Supabase?
faq.answer: The patterns assume Supabase but can be adapted for other auth providers by modifying the validation helper.

faq.question: Is my data stored or transmitted anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides code patterns. Your data stays within your application.

faq.question: Endpoints created with these patterns do not work. What should I check?
faq.answer: Verify you have the required imports from lib/supabase and lib/api-helpers. Check that your table exists in Supabase.

faq.question: How does this compare to standard Next.js API routes?
faq.answer: These patterns extend standard routes with multi-tenant security, consistent error handling, and Supabase integration.
